items.q: This fall, the school will be offering classes in money management. ____________________ (In addition / During), we will hold a one-day workshop on money management this November.
Screen doors provide a lot of benefits. ____________________ (If / For instance), they help keep out insects.
The soccer game will be played this Saturday, ____________________ (regardless of / before) the weather.
Researchers have discovered a new kind of mosquito, the Lancer. ____________________ (This type of / Another) mosquito thrives in cool climates.
Many people believe in global warming. ____________________ (For instance / Still), some scientists assert that there is no real evidence for global warming.
They used many different kinds of fertilizer on their crops for years, without success. ____________________ (Finally / Regardless of), they decided to try a different approach.
We could serve fish or chicken at the dinner. ____________________ (That is / Another) alternative would be to just have hamburgers.
____________________ (Before / During ) entering my sister's apartment, I need to take off my shoes.
tend to cost a. always cost b. never cost c. usually cost
seasoned a. delicious b. experienced c. related
petty a. not important b. not expensive c. not friendly
to rank a. to stand b. to put in order c. to lie down
properly a. correctly b. slowly c. quickly
to clarify a. to clean b. to rinse c. to make clear
practically dead a. almost dead b. completely dead c. used to be dead
no wonder a. not surprising b. very surprising c. very boring
fairly expensive a. reasonably priced b. above average in price c. cheap
to skip lunch a. to eat lunch quickly b. to make lunch c. to not eat lunch

The military general retires at the end of this year. The military general is in charge of NATO troops. a. The military general who is in charge of NATO troops retires at the end of this year. b. The military general in charge of NATO troops who retires at the end of this year. c. The military general, which is in charge of NATO troops retires at the end of this year.

The US states are Nevada, Arizona, and Florida. These states have seen huge population booms. a. The US states that have seen huge population booms are Nevada, Arizona, and Florida. b. The US states that are Nevada, Arizona, and Florida have seen huge population booms. c. The US states, that have seen huge population booms, are Nevada, Arizona, and Florida.

I'm not sure what I'm going to do about this job. I hate this job. a. I hate this job that I'm not sure what I'm going to do about it. b. I'm not sure, what I'm going to do about this job, which I hate. c. I'm not sure what I'm going to do about this job that I hate.

To me, people have more relaxed personalities. People live in temperate climates. a. To me people which live in temperate climates have more relaxed personalities. b. To me, people who live in temperate climates have more relaxed personalities. c. To me, people who have more relaxed personalities that live in temperate climates.

San Diego is in southern California. It has a sunny, warm climate all year. a. San Diego, which is in southern California, has a sunny, warm climate all year. b. San Diego is in southern California that has a sunny, warm climate all year. c. San Diego that is in southern California has a sunny, warm climate all year.

I saw a new car yesterday. It was nice and reasonably priced. a. The nice and reasonably priced new car which I saw yesterday. b. The new car which I saw yesterday was nice and reasonably priced. c. The new car that I saw yesterday was nice and reasonably priced.

Jonathan works as a translator for the United Nations. Jonathan can speak five languages fluently. a. Jonathan who can speak five languages fluently works as a translator for the United Nations. b. Jonathan, who can speak five languages fluently, works as a translator for the United Nations. c. Jonathan, can speak five languages fluently, works as a translator for the United Nations.

The newest location will be in the Lakefront Shopping Mall. The newest location opens in May. a. The newest location that opens in May will be in the Lakefront Shopping Mall. b. The newest location, that opens in May, will be in the Lakefront Shopping Mall. c. The newest location, which opens in May, will be in the Lakefront Shopping Mall.

Last night, we saw a movie. The movie has my favorite actress in it. a. Last night, we saw a movie has my favorite actress in it. b. Last night, we saw a movie who has my favorite actress in it. c. Last night, we saw a movie that has my favorite actress in it.

The doctor gave her medicine. The medicine cleared up the infection. a. The doctor gave her medicine cleared up the infection. b. The doctor gave her medicine that cleared up the infection. c. The doctor gave her medicine, that cleared up the infection.
She asked us to classify these books _____ different categories.
Harold wouldn't give me a _____ example of what I'd done wrong.
That famous actress is performing _____ stage here Saturday night.
I really don't want to fight _____ who should do the dishes.
Jordan struck _____ a conversation with the woman sitting next to him on the bus.
All my roommates _____ along really well.
There are two varieties _____ roses I really like: climbing roses and bush roses.
He knows a lot about many different subjects, ranging _____ science to medieval history.
I really don't see how that pertains _____ the topic.
Our final _____ on this trip will be Athens, Greece.
My sister which lives in Maryland is coming to visit me next week. _________________________
The assignment, which the professor assigned last week, is extremely time consuming. _________________________
Have you seen the movie who was filmed in the Arctic yet? _________________________
Irene, who lives next door, just bought a new car. _________________________
The new art exhibit that's showing at the Modern Museum of Art is amazing! _________________________
The author's new book, which came out a month ago, has already sold a million copies. _________________________
The baseball player which has the best batting average will win an award. _________________________
The team that wins this game will be the world champions. _________________________
Have you ever gone to the bookstore who is next to the post office ? _________________________
Helen Keller, who was well known for being blind and deaf, was not born with these conditions. _________________________
Traces of arsenic, that is a deadly poison , were found in the man's body. _________________________
In recent years, the fastest-selling vehicle who is on the market is the SUV. _________________________
(2) can be found __________
(6) are housed __________
(9) have become __________
(10) are offered __________
Classify types of students into two or three subcategories. Make sure that all of your examples fit into one of the subcategories. Use several connectors and transitions in your essay.
